definition: lit. as if walking on thin ice (idiom)/fig. to be extremely cautious/to be skating on thin ice
as/as if/such as
shoe/to tread on
meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
see 薄荷[bo4 he5]
surname Bo
thin/cold in manner/indifferent/weak/light/infertile
variant of 冰[bing1]
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: Saw manager the whole face is not happy, we gingerly, cautious.
sentences.chinese: 看到经理满脸不高兴，我们战战兢兢，如履薄冰。

sentences.english: There you would really think the formalists are on thin ice.
sentences.chinese: 你会发现形式主义者的论点在这里如履薄冰。

sentences.english: I was walking on eggs when I asked the boss about my salary.
sentences.chinese: 我问老板我的工资时如履薄冰。

sentences.english: Today, Kaifeng Jews tread with caution.
sentences.chinese: 如今，开封犹太人如履薄冰。

sentences.english: Love are treading on thin ice, but the pain ruyingsuixing.
sentences.chinese: 缫爱情如履薄冰，痛苦却如影随形。

sentences.english: He's on very thin ice now, you know?
sentences.chinese: 你知道，他现在是如履薄冰。

sentences.english: You'll be skating on thin ice if you press on harder.
sentences.chinese: 您可谓如履薄冰，如果您按下就更难。

sentences.english: Strong sense of responsibility, enabled us to each creation skating on thin ice.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的责任感，使我们对每一次的创作如履薄冰。

sentences.english: However, this love, always in fear, treading on thin ice.
sentences.chinese: 但这种爱，总让人战战兢兢，如履薄冰。

sentences.english: Skate over thin ice, like standing upon edge of abyss.
I walk on eggshells around you.
sentences.chinese: 我面对你都如履薄冰的。

definition: trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
danger lurks on every side (idiom)
cautious and timid (idiom); prudent/careful
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
faulted at every turn (idiom); can't get anything right
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
panic-stricken
lit. wind sighing and crane calling (idiom)/fig. to panic at the slightest move/to be jittery
to have difficulty walking (idiom)/to walk with difficulty
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
lit. every tree or bush an enemy soldier (idiom); fig. to panic and treat everyone as an enemy/to feel beleaguered
being close to the sovereign can be as perilous as lying with a tiger (idiom)
afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
